thread.title: Bryce Harper hits tape-measure home run in first spring at-bat
thread.title_full: Bryce Harper hits tape-measure home run in first spring at-bat

title: Bryce Harper hits tape-measure home run in first spring at-bat
text:
Bryce Harper hits tape-measure home run in first spring at-bat First at-bat? Forget about it.@Bharper3407 is ridiculous: https://t.co/3HzORPyfAB #Crushed pic.twitter.com/tH6L6wGorB — MLB (@MLB) February 25, 2017 Washington — MLB (@MLB) February 25, 2017 
Washington Nationals star Bryce Harper wants to return to form this season after struggling at the plate in 2016. 
And if his first at-bat of spring training is any indication, Harper's well on his way to another eye-popping campaign as one of baseball's finest young players. 
Harper dispensed the first pitch he saw Saturday afternoon from Mets hurler Sean GilMartin over the wall in right, a tape-measure shot measuring over 450 feet. 
Last season, Harper hit 24 home runs, drove in 86 runs and struggled with a .243 batting average. Author
